newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds flat, looking for direction.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds flat, looking for direction.

text.p: Argentine bonds were flat Friday amid thin trading volumes.
Traders said the market was largely unchanged due to a lack of news on the government's latest economic measures.
"For now we need a political signal for the market to find a new direction," said a trader with a large foreign bank.
The 5.5 percent dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 were flat at 114.80 while Argentina's FRB due 2005 was up 1/8 at $77-5/8.
Traders expected directionless markets Friday on hesitancy ahead of the U.S. Labor Day holiday on Monday.
Still, traders repeated that with a slightly negative tone still gripping the U.S. Treasuries market, the fact that Argentine bonds were holding up was a positive sign for the week to come.
